jeopardy_round: WHAT CENTURY ARE YOU LIVING IN?

(1, 1).clue: Dylan Thomas had years of strife with the Inland Revenue, Britain's counterpart of this U.S. agency

(2, 1).clue: This feel-good film starred Dennis Quaid as Jim Morris, a major league rookie at age 35

(3, 1).clue: Edwin Land & Alexander Graham Bell are among those honored at Ohio's national hall of fame for these people

(5, 1).clue: David & Elizabeth Emanuel got the assignment to design this for Princess Diana to wear on July 29, 1981

(6, 1).clue: Sly & crafty, like a cartoon coyote

(2, 2).clue: Kevin Costner was the bodyguard assigned to Whitney Houston in this 1992 romance

(3, 2).clue: "King Me" if you know that Petal, Mississippi is home to the international hall of fame for this game

(5, 2).clue: 19th century Englishmen Thomas & William Bowler got their names in the dictionary by making these

(6, 2).clue: Superstition says touch a frog or toad & you'll get one of these on your hand

(1, 3).clue: Brazil's legislature includes the Chamber of these, also found working for sheriffs

(2, 3).clue: Mel Gibson tries to find out what women want in this romantic comedy

(3, 3).clue: Marcus Allen & John Elway were among the 2001 enshrinees in this hall of fame in South Bend, Indiana

(4, 3).clue: Christopher Marlowe (assuming he didn't fake his own death, move to France & write Shakespeare's plays)

(5, 3).clue: With grenade loops added, the coat designed by Thomas Burberry got this new name during World War I

(6, 3).clue: It often precedes west, fire & flower

(1, 4).clue: In Jordan, members of the senate are appointed by this person, but they can't be his relatives

(2, 4).clue: Robert De Niro played Stanley & Jane Fonda was Iris in this 1990 film

(3, 4).clue: A horse racing hall of fame is right across from this famous track in eastern New York

(6, 4).clue: A thin puff of smoke; there is a "Will O' the" one

(1, 5).clue: Although they made the musical about Evita, this third wife of Juan Peron was president of Argentina

(2, 5).clue: Edward Burns wrote, directed & starred in this 1995 film about 3 brothers: Jack, Barry & Patrick McMullen

(3, 5).clue: Eveleth, Minnesota & Toronto, Canada each have halls of fame devoted to this sport

(5, 5).clue: Sharp suits & skinny ties typified the '60s look of the "squad" of these young Britishers

(6, 5).clue: To draw to a close, or to decrease, like the visible side of the moon after it's been full

(1, 1).clue: In 1936 Time Magazine featured this mustachioed Surrealist on its cover

(2, 1).clue: In this job, Maxwell Perkins earned readers' thanks by cutting the length of Thomas Wolfe's books

(3, 1).clue: Experts can identify whale species by the shape & height of water vapor expelled through these apertures

(4, 1).clue: A race-conscious term, buppie is short for this

(5, 1).clue: She won a 1993 Emmy for playing an impulsive public relations executive & a 1997 Oscar for playing a waitress

(6, 1).clue: This ancient work is set in the final year of the Trojan War

(1, 2).clue: In Masaccio's "Expulsion from Paradise", an archangel with a sword hovers over this pair

(2, 2).clue: It's the "mountain" growing flower seen here

(3, 2).clue: These thin plates that hang from the upper jaw of the bowhead whale may reach a length of 13 feet

(4, 2).clue: An anti-substance abuse program's slogan is this "To Keep Kids Off Drugs"

(5, 2).clue: This former Cosmo editor once quipped, "Good girls go to heaven, bad girls go everywhere"

(6, 2).clue: He deserted Oenone, a nymph, to run off with Helen of Troy

(1, 3).clue: The Nabis were painters in Paris who emulated the primitive style of this artist who left France for Tahiti in 1891

(2, 3).clue: A mall is a major attraction in this Canadian provincial capital that averages 8 degrees F. in January

(3, 3).clue: This term refers to whales leaping out of the water & falling back with a big splash

(4, 3).clue: Itself an acronym, it's the A in ARC, when the RC is "related complex"

(5, 3).clue: This Aussie's hits include "Delta Dawn", "I Am Woman", & "Angie Baby"

(6, 3).clue: Hecuba had 19 children by this king of Troy

(1, 4).clue: This artist born in 1471 probably learned everything from his father, a goldsmith, also named Albrecht

(2, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Heritage Village in Cincinnati)  In 1874 this man invented the quadriplex system to handle 4 messages at once over one wire

(3, 4).clue: This substance from the intestines of sperm whales is still used as a fixative for expensive perfumes

(4, 4).clue: It's the first "I" in ASCII, a computer code for representing letters as numbers

(3, 5).clue: This Arctic whale has only 2 teeth; the left one in males may grow to 9 feet
